intro: Cyrtandra jonesii, commonly known as Jones' cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a glossy surface and is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests. It is a perennial shrub that can grow up to several feet in height, and it plays an important role in the ecological diversity of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
